title-group.article-title: A Note on Teaching Liquidity Risk

abstract.p: Investors in thinly traded stocks bear liquidity risk, which is briefly discussed in most introductory finance courses but is rarely illustrated or given hands-on pedagogical treatment. This paper illustrates liquidity risk with a specific example, demonstrates a statistical test for market efficiency, and provides an open access spreadsheet for calculations. Tests to measure learning are also described. Students will benefit from a qualitative and quantitative example of a type of investment risk often overlooked in classroom discussions. The class exercise is appropriate for Finance or Quantitative Methods courses.
